main event: A radar and visual sighting of an oval-shaped object moving rapidly from east to west at an altitude of 4,000 feet before disappearing behind clouds.
interesting points: The object was observed for only 12 seconds.
No other characteristics of the object could be determined, as it disappeared behind clouds.
The report includes a sighting summary from a ship called the 'SS Sunny Lady', which observed eight red flashing lights moving very fast from west to east at a great altitude.
The report mentions that the day copy was destroyed, and the second and third lines were amended to be classified as 'OD'.
The report was part of Project 10073, the US Air Force's official program for investigating Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOs).
